uniq
====
Removes all duplicates from an array in place.

Usage
=====
First install using npm:

    npm install uniq
    
Then use it as follows:

```javascript

var arr = [1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 5]

require("uniq")(arr)
console.log(arr)

//Prints:
//
//  1,2,3,5
//
```

## `require("uniq")(array[, compare, sorted])`
Removes all duplicates from a sorted array in place.

* `array` is the array to remove items from
* `compare` is an optional comparison function that returns 0 when two items are equal, and something non-zero when they are different.  If unspecified, then the default equals will be use
